intro: Nephrodium retrorsum, commonly known as the backward-veined fern, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that have a unique, backward-curving vein pattern. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rhizome is creeping and produces numerous short, upright fronds. The leaves are usually bi- or tri-pinnate, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
